New Records: India scored the highest total ever at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua with 196 runs for the loss of 5 wickets.
Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya starred with both bat and ball, winning the player of the match award.
Kuldeep Yadav claimed the best figures for India on the day with 4-0-19-3.
Jasprit Bumrah finished with figures of 4-0-13-2.
Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Rishabh Pant showed incredible intent with the bat.
Shivam Dube hit 3 sixes in the last few balls of his innings to score 34 off 24 balls.
Hardik Pandya played an intelligent innings of 50* off 27 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Before the toss, Harsha Bhogle mentioned that the pitch was going to get progressively slower as the sun was going to take its toll on the wicket.
Post-Match Reflections: With the win, India have one foot into the semi-finals spots with a massive NRR boost. India will qualify for the semi-final if Afghanistan beat Australia on June 23.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh captain Najmul Shanto opted to bat first in a day game, which turned out to be a mistake as the pitch got slower.
Fiesty fast bowler Tanzid Hasan Shakib was the pick amongst the bowlers for Bangladesh, taking 2/32 from his 4 overs.
Young leg spinner Rishad Hossain picked 2 wickets but was expensive, leaking 43 off his 4 overs.
